explanations.A: Firstly we calculate the vector from left to right. This is a horizontal change of 9 and vertical of -6. We need two thirds of that vector to find P, two thirds gives us a horizontal change of 6 and vertical of -4. Applying that to the coordinates on the left (1,8), we get (1+6, 8-4) = (7, 4).
explanations.B: I think you've moved one third to the left from the right-hand point, however I think you've become confused when looking at your coordinates, applying the horizontal movement to y and the vertical movement to x. Remember that the first value is x which is horizontal, and the second value is y which is vertical.
explanations.C: Almost there! You've worked out P being one-third from the left, but we need it to be two thirds from the left.
explanations.D: It looks like you've found the midpoint of the two coordinates, but we need the point P which is two-thirds from the left to the right. Perhaps thinking of this as a ratio would help.

explanations.D: I think you've moved 3 left and 3 up from the right-hand coordinate. Make sure you are calculating the horizontal and vertical difference between the two points, and then finding three-quarters of that to apply to the left coordinate.
